description:
Looked like it would fit my use case almost perfectly. Installed it, set up a couple notebooks with the needed notes, used it for a couple days, then closed the program.

Opened it up a day later and everything thing is gone. No notebook, no notes, nothing. 

Can not even reload a backup as the program did not even bother to save anything so backup to load.
Trying to find a new application to use with KDE and Markdown found this one but can't understand how to open a file.md previously created ...

Currently I can't seem to be able to create a new note? I make a notebook, and there's no button to make a note within it. If I use the sidebar hamburger menu, and click on the new note button, nothing happens.

I am very glad there is a new, non-electron notes application in active development, and I can't wait to be able to use this productively.
summary: Looks great, but needs more love

description:
Works well on my machine.
Quite easy to use and intuitive.
There are bugs here and there, but nothing critical.
Hope, the app's userbase gonna grow and the app itself will continue to evolve.
